pullRequest.title: [KOGITO-2121] MongoDB for Data Index service
pullRequest.bodyText:
Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2121
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2122
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2146
Description:
Support mongodb as persistence solution for data index. Support indexing and health check with mongodb.
Many thanks for submitting your Pull Request ❤️!
Please make sure that your PR meets the following requirements:

 You have read the contributors guide
 Pull Request title is properly formatted: KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request title contains the target branch if not targeting master: [0.9.x] KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request contains link to the JIRA issue
 Pull Request contains link to any dependent or related Pull Request
 Pull Request contains description of the issue
 Pull Request does not include fixes for issues other than the main ticket

nodes.bodyText: Just a very small side note that is not really related to this PR. Isnt't better to rename them setObjectCreatedListener since there can be just one listener?
Shouldn't return v instead of the oldvalue?
Can you please move version definition to kogito-runtimes bom?

+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

+            <quarkus.test.profile>mongodb</quarkus.test.profile>

nodes.bodyText: Can you explain the reason of this? (same question for fromObjectNode)
Why two different ids?
What is the reason for the changes of this class? Unused fields?

+
+import org.kie.kogito.persistence.api.schema.ProcessDescriptor;
+
+public class ProcessIndexEvent {

nodes.bodyText: What is the reason of this sleep?

The semantic of all these methods is getOrCreate so can you please use mongoDBStorageFactory.getOrCreateStorage also in these two methods?
Actually I think it could be nice to rename getCache methods to better explain the idea but let's do it in another PR because otherwise we will have a lot of code changes and review it will be harder
Please consider this and relative quarkus issue

Is it possible to move this impl (or part of it) to common module?
I think it could be nice if we can limit code user has to write to use this library to the different implementations of AbstractStorage and then leverage on CDI to retrieve in a generic way all the components.
Wdyt?

What about move this fail statement just after ctx.registerProtoFiles(invalidFileDescriptorSource)? You can remove return fromcatch block in this case and I think it is a bit more readable.
Wdyt?

nodes.bodyText: could you use https://www.testcontainers.org/modules/databases/mongodb/ instead of a generic container?

nodes.bodyText: @xiezhang7 I believe id should be enough to identify the same job.
same here, id should be enough to identify the same process instance
@xiezhang7 wouldnt mongodb create the _id anyway and assign a primary key for that? If thats the case then we can simple resue the id attribute that we already provide.
_id or id should be enough to identify the node instance.
shouldnt this be just an embedded document, do we actually need an id for it?
id should be used enough here to identify the same task.
could you use the constructor or init method for this?
perhpas use a @before or @beforeall for initialization?
same here, using a @before/all
same @before
do we need  + "_process1" in here?
same, do we need "_job1" ?
same regarding "_task1"
@xiezhang7 perhpas these tests should extend StorageTestBase ?
@xiezhang7 I think we should review and simply include this module by default. Otherwise we will have issues to keep it up-to-date if not part of the default build.

it should be able to add a list of listeners.
Also, take a look at https://mongodb.github.io/mongo-java-driver/4.0/driver/tutorials/change-streams/
We should be able to get changes done even from another runtime instance.
please include in the main profile

nodes.bodyText: @xiezhang7 shouldn't this be handled by the addObjectCreatedListener method so it only returns once subscription.request is called?
Could we simply reuse the same proto files for both tests?
@xiezhang7 shouldn't we reuse the MongoClient created by Quarkus instead? You should be able to retrieve that using injection.
so it seems that we're creating multiple databases per type. Could we simplify that so there is only one database with multiple collections?
@xiezhang7 should be enough to override this property using System.setProperty that way I think you can avoid creating the MongoConfigSource
maybe just comment out this, otherwise it can be quite verbose on Jenkins build.

commit.message: Use mongo client for query operator
Documentation for data index with MongoDB
Use testcontainers mongodb module for mongodb integration test
Use MongoDB ChangeStream for object listener
Add mongodb integration tests for data-index-service
Use getter and setter for the entity
